ballsPresent.description: Indicates the presence of at least one ball, as in 'he brought a ball, there are now balls present'

capacity0.string: You have<x id='START_SPAN'/>0<x id='END_SPAN'/> blocks left.
capacity0.description: warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 0 with one or more words.

capacity1.string: You have <x id='START_SPAN'/>1<x id='END_SPAN'/> block left.
capacity1.description: warning - Only one more block may be added.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 1 with one or more words.

capacity2.string: You have <x id='START_SPAN'/>%1<x id='END_SPAN'/> blocks left.
capacity2.description: warning - Only %1 more blocks may be used, where %1 is an integer greater than 1.  Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase.

codeTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.

doCode.description: verb - imperative or infinitive preceding one or more commands to a person.

elseCode.description: conjunction - 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.

finalLevel.string: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
finalLevel.description: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.

holesPresent.description: Indicates the lack of any balls, as in 'she took the last ball, there are now no balls present'

ifTooltip.string: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
ifTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

ifelseTooltip.string: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
ifelseTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

linkTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the user's program to be saved and for a URL to be provided for retrieving it.  The word 'blocks' is as in children's toy blocks.

maze.description: brief title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Maze''' tutorial.

moveForward.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking) in the direction he/she is facing.

moveForwardTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

nextLevel.string: Congratulations! You have completed this level.
nextLevel.description: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the maze, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty.

noPathAhead.description: condensed form of 'if there is a no path ahead', as in: 'if no path ahead, go forward'.

noPathLeft.description: condensed form of 'if there is a no path to the left', as in: 'if no path to the left, turn left'.

noPathRight.description: condensed form of 'if there is a no path to the right', as in: 'if no path to the right, turn right'.

numBlocksNeeded.string: This level can be solved with %1 blocks.
numBlocksNeeded.description: alert - This is displayed when the user has used more blocks than is necessary.

oneTopBlock.string: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
oneTopBlock.description: alert - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.

pathAhead.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path ahead', as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.

pathLeft.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path to the left', as in: 'if path to the left, turn left'.

pathRight.description: condensed form of 'if there is a path to the right', as in: 'if path to the right, turn right'.

pickUpBall.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person picking up a ball.

pickupTower.description: Place a tower up off the ground

putDownBall.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person putting down a ball.

putdownTower.description: Place a tower on the ground

q10right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q10wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q10wrong.description: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

q4right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q4wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q4wrong.description: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

q5right.description: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

q5wrong.string: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
q5wrong.description: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

repeatUntilBlocked.description: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands.  The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.

repeatUntilFinish.description: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands.  The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.

repeatWhileCurrentNotClear.description: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands.  The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.

resetProgram.description: button label - Pressing the button causes Pegman return to the start of the maze (but does not delete the user's program.)

runProgram.description: button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.

turnLeft.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation counter-clockwise.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

turnRight.description: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

turnTooltip.string: Turns me left or right by 90 degrees.
turnTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

while.description: condensed form of 'while something is true'

whileTooltip.string: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
whileTooltip.description: tooltip (pop-up help) - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
